intro: Eryngium wolffii, commonly known as the blue thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiky, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has silvery-gray, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or dry environments. Eryngium wolffii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in garden landscapes.
